item.title: UK Users Preorder win7 now!
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:38, topic:288874”]You are not allowed to use your marked position to gain benefit in another marked.
MS uses their position in OS marked to dominate the Browser marked, IE 6 and 7 is not much used because of they are good, but because they are build into Windows.

Apple have a big control of the MP3/4 player marked, but they not using that to make Mac more popular, iTunes can be used on Windows and Mac, so iPod is not “forcing” you to use Mac if you want to use iPod.[/quote]
no but they force you to use itunes over say WMP or winamp, it was an example oh how other companies do it in other sectors. I personally dont care about the browser market i use what is good alot of people (even chavs and morons) install firefox and use that instead so the EU should just fuck off with their political bullshit about windows pushing IE

item.title: UK Users Preorder win7 now!
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:33, topic:288874”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=381896.msg2873678#msg2873678 date=1247926191]
Uh, you guys do realise Windows 7 contains an FTP client right?

Windows 7 dosen’t include a browser because of EU competition rulings, not because of choice. Because, MS is so evil, their OS can’t come with a browser, that would be terrible! I mean, its not like OSX comes with Safari or anything, or most linux distributions contain an open source browser of some kind.
[/quote]
They could include IE 8, and the solution they choose now is as bad as include IE 8 in Windows 7.
What EU wants is Microsoft to include other browsers like FireFox and Opera.

Microsoft have a big markets dominance and are not allowed to use it in a unfair way, Mac and all Linux Desktop Distro has an low market share and they can do more like they want.[/quote]
which seems unfair because microsoft got themselves into a position to have this dominance so they should flaunt it, its like apple in the MP3 sector, its not like they say oh well you can sell your iPod’s but you cant make it just work with itunes

Read full topic

item.title: UK Users Preorder win7 now!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

All they’ve gotta do is get it signed. I must admit that bugged me at first, but I can see their reasoning. It would have been nice if we could disable it, but hey they chose not to allow it.

It’s a nice security feature, incidentally, but you won’t hear FLOSSfags promoting this feature when they’re bitching about how insecure Windows is.

Read full topic

item.title: UK Users Preorder win7 now!
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:21, topic:288874”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=381896.msg2872417#msg2872417 date=1247851750]
Slightly off-topic: I really hope ChromeOS will support as much software as Windows; Microsoft has really screwed up with Vista/7…
[/quote]
It will hopefully support all Linux software and Wine.
And new software will be made to ChromeOS/Linux.

But I don’t see any problem with programs not working on Windows 7, what does not work for you?[/quote]
Drivers (SAS Controller), Games that must use anti-cheat engines (Punkbuster), basically anything that must modify the kernel.

item.title: UK Users Preorder win7 now!
item.dc:creator: @pookey71 Pookey71
item.description:
@pookey71 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:29, topic:288874”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=381896.msg2873595#msg2873595 date=1247917715]

Within the EU, the Windows 7 range does not contain a pre-installed internet browser.

So how are you to get on the internet to get a browser?

A CD with IE 8 will be included.

A whole cd?

as opposed to half a CD…

Can people l2downloadfirefoxandusbstick and l2downloadfirefoxandburntocd
Unhandled you are like the only person that is intelligent enough to realise this.

This is what Amazon claims you must do:

Within the EU, the Windows 7 range does not contain a pre-installed internet browser. One option to gain access to the internet is:
• On your current computer prior to installing Windows 7, or on another computer system, download the install file (usually a “.exe” file) for your preferred Windows 7-compatible browser to your current system.
• Burn this file to a CD or DVD or transfer it to an external storage medium such as a flash memory drive or external hard drive.
• Install Windows 7 on your system using the instructions provided with your purchase.
• Once you have installed Windows 7 on your system insert the CD/DVD or connect the external storage device and copy the install file to your Windows 7 system.
• Run the install file to install your preferred web browser and access the internet.

These instructions are provided for your information only and you may wish to explore other options. Amazon accepts no responsibility for any problems you may encounter from following the instructions above. Be sure to check out Amazon’s great selection of external storage devices in our electronics store.
[/quote]
i know that, it was just the way he said ‘a whole CD’ i was making a joke that you cant have a half a CD you are stupid not to realise this[/quote]
Sanga, all I saw was "DUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUURRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR’ He was making a sarcastic comment, can you please l2read.

Read full topic
